title: @KateyKhaos Do you ever 'spice up' skins?
body:
By that I mean do you ever add any additional things to a skin that would make the skin better looking, almost like a rework to a champion's abilities?

For example, I think Shadow Prince Malzahar would be LOVELY with gold particle effects on his passive, Q, W (gold voidlings!) E and R. Would it be possible to see changes like that, which would make a complete addition to the skin?

replies.body:
They've done this in the past, but aside from an across-the-board update that all the skins get, adding new things could bump up the price tier and seems to be something they avoid.

I'd suggest hitting her up on her [ask.fm page](http://ask.fm/kateykhaos) or [twitter](https://twitter.com/RiotKateyKhaos). She does read the forums, but asking there guarantees she doesn't miss it.

> I'd suggest hitting her up on her [ask.fm page](http://ask.fm/kateykhaos) or [twitter](https://twitter.com/RiotKateyKhaos). She does read the forums, but asking there guarantees she doesn't miss it.

Well what about instead of increasing the price tier, why not just have all skins regardless of price have particle effect changes? For the cheaper ones, it would be just a minor color change, but of course for the pricier ones it'd obviously be a whole new effect.

And looking at that financially, I'd assume that would actually increase skin sales, as it makes lower-tier skins more enticing to be bought without decreasing the sales of higher tier skins. Some (but not all) people aren't always willing to buy the higher tier skins but would rather buy the lower tier skins, and simultaneously keeping top tier skins steady in sales (me included!) as people willing to buy the big time skins will still buy them. Because who doesn't like to show off some bizazz?

Hi! 

> By that I mean do you ever add any additional things to a skin that would make the skin better looking, almost like a rework to a champion's abilities?

This actually isn't something that skins team would handle, but rather champion update. That said, particles generally are not updated unless we're doing a larger scale champion update, such as Taric, Tristana, or even the Morgana update we did earlier this year. 

> For example, I think Shadow Prince Malzahar would be LOVELY with gold particle effects on his passive, Q, W (gold voidlings!) E and R. Would it be possible to see changes like that, which would make a complete addition to the skin?

At this time, we do not have plans to update existing skins and add particles, recall animations, etc. to them.

so even if money is spent on a skin only to get it's quality later reduced is an okay thing then? If you have decent kiting with malz that spellshield is basically always up completely invalidating the point of buying any skin that isn't snow day malz which is only available basically during the xmas season. I would have assumed it was an oversight which happens, nobody is perfect and whole teams can miss details, but flat out ignoring it feels more like a middle finger honestly.

> so even if money is spent on a skin only to get it's quality later reduced is an okay thing then?

That's not the goal, no. If you're speaking in terms of Malzahar, the skins align with what they had previously. With updates, if skins used the base particles prior, they would likely use the base particles after the update. 

Would you mind giving me an example of the quality being reduced on a skin?

> If you have decent kiting with malz that spellshield is basically always up completely invalidating the point of buying any skin that isn't snow day malz which is only available basically during the xmas season.

The spellshield detail was added because he was a 975 RP skin, so the team felt it was something that should be changed as well. 

> I would have assumed it was an oversight which happens

You're correct, this does happen. In fact, it happened with Jade Fang Cassiopeia, where the team didn't realize she had unique VFX. They're in the process of correcting that and giving her VFX that align better with the unique VFX she had before.

Thanks for the reply. Honestly amazed you have been keeping up with so many of them over the past few days in general for responding.
The specific point about the malz skin I feel has its quality reduced is the fact that I said before if the spell shield spends most of its time up then you are basically playing with classic malz. I know that the argument can be made that snow day got a full new set up of colors for for his skills and therefore the passive, and shadow prince not having it for the skills wasn't an issue really but having the skin blocked of for a significant portion of the game for shadow prince is honestly disappointing to the point that the skin no longer feels it has it previous uniqueness.

> Thanks for the reply. Honestly amazed you have been keeping up with so many of them over the past few days in general for responding.

I try! Sometimes, I end up swamped in work and replies may lag a bit. :P

I know that the argument can be made that snow day got a full new set up of colors for for his skills and therefore the passive, and shadow prince not having it for the skills wasn't an issue really but having the skin blocked of for a significant portion of the game for shadow prince is honestly disappointing to the point that the skin no longer feels it has it previous uniqueness.

I totally get where you're coming from, and honestly, I appreciate the constructive feedback. I'd be more than happy to pass this on to Champion Update. ^-^
